physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Erythrodermic psoriasis resistant to treatment, stabilized with combination of cyclosporine (5 mg/kg per day) and azathioprine (2 mg/kg per day).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Skin disease improved and all systemic treatments were withdrawn.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Found to have a mass in the right iliac fossa during physical examination.

physical_examinations.date: 1998 (within 24 hours after administration of contrast medium)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Skin deteriorated, developing erythroderma similar to previous exacerbations of psoriasis.
Erythroderma again developed after second contrast medium administration.
Skin deteriorated again within 24 hours after re-administration of iopamidol contrast medium.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Connection between exacerbations of psoriasis and radiologic investigations realized.
